post.description: Logs a user into the service. Users are required to log in with an email and password. This returns an access token that can be used for future requests.
Invalidates a user's current logged in session.

409.description: A user with this email already exists.

post.description: Creates a request to reset the user's password.

requestBody.description: The information about the user who's password should be reset.

patch.description: Resets the password for the user specified in the request body.

requestBody.description: The new password for this user

409.description: A user with this email already exists.

get.description: Retrieves the user with this id. For privacy reason, this call can only be made by the user with this id to return the full user object.
Retrieves the user with this id. For privacy reason, this call can only be made by the user with this id to return the full user object.

patch.summary: Updates the user with this id
patch.description: Updates the user with this id. The firstname and lastname of the user must be specified. The user's email address or profile picture can not be updated with this call. An access token must be specified for this call. An access token only gives access for a user to make this call on a specific user id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: id of the user to update. This id must match the id of the user making the call

post.description: Upload new profile picture for this user. This will replace any existing profile picture.

requestBody.description: The file to upload. Files must be in JPEG, PNG or GIF format and limited to 1 MB.

400.description: Bad request. Problem with the profile picture such us file format is invalid of the image is too large.
bad request. the profile pictture does not exist.

post.description: Change this user's password. Password should be at least 8 characters long.

requestBody.description: JSON object containing the old password and new password.

400.description: Bad request. There was a problem with either the `current` or `new` password parameter.

Workspace.description: A workspace defines a unit such as an organization, a team or a department with an organization. Teams, projects and billing is scoped by the workspace.

slug.description: This is used to identify the workspace in URLs

ownerId.description: The user id of the owner of this workspace.

billingNote.description: A note that is attached to all invoices associated with this workspace. This can be an adress, phone number or any other pertinent info workspace admins deem important to add to their invoices.

Project.description: Represents a project. A project contains a set of strings that can be translated into other languages.

languageId.description: The base language for the project. Each project has a base language that the content is created in. This language can then be translated into other languages.

userId.description: The id of the user that created this project.

workspaceId.description: The id of the workspace this project belongs to.

localName.description: The local name of the language when written in the language.

flagUrl.description: This is usually a url to the flag of the country where this language is predominantly spoken or associated with.

countryCode.description: The iso country code for the country where this language is predominantly spoken.

String.description: Represents a single unit of translatable text. This can be word, a sentence or a paragraph.

value.description: The value for this string. This is the text to be translated.

autoTranslation.description: The automatic translation for this strings orignal content (`value`).

humanTranslation.description: Human modified translation. This key overrides the `autoTranslation` field whenever present.

File.description: Represents a localization strings file within a project in LocalizeWiz.

type.description: The type of this file. All supported file types are option.

status.description: The upload status of this file.

metadata.description: Arbitrary metadata about this file. This field is mostly unused.

stringsCount.description: The number or strings in this file

referrerId.description: The user id of user that created this invitation

workspaceId.description: The id of the workspace this invitation belongs to.

status.description: The status of this invitation. Possible values are pending, accepted, declined.

Notification.description: An event a user can be notified about, such as when a user has a pending invitation.

userId.description: The user this notification pertains to.

status.description: The status of this notification. Possible values are pending, accepted, declined

Plan.description: Each organization or workspace is signed on to a given plan. The plan determines the limits for projects in the workspace and across the workspace as a whole.

tier.description: The tier of the plan. Tiers are from 0 - free plan to 5 - Enterprise plan.

description.example: The startup plan is for indie developers, startups and small teams.

projectLimit.description: The maximum number of projects that can be created when signed on to this plan.

stringLimit.description: The maximum total number of strings this plan can host across all projects.

languageLimit.description: The maximum number of languages that can be added to a project under this plan.

ChangePassword.description: Contains the current and new password.

LoginRequest.description: Email and password for logging in.

expiry.description: Expiry is three months from creation date

resetId.name: id
resetId.description: The id for a password reset request

bearerAuth.description: authenticated users receive an access token which can be used to update the user object. This **must be used together with an `apiKey`.

apiKeyAuth.name: x-api-key
apiKeyAuth.description: An `apiKey` is required to make requests to the Wiz Api, except for when using an `appId` in one of our native app SDKs. If you do not have an apiKey, use 420fa420820402422042 for testing.

appId.name: x-app-id
appId.description: This field must be specified when using our iOS or Android SDK. If you do not have an appId, get one when you sign up on https://wiz.localizewiz.com
